helperMessage.messageTxt: In some countries, Social Security Number can only be used for certain purposes, such as for payroll processing or tax reporting. We recommend that you consult with local counsel to determine when collection of this information is permissible.

In some countries, collection of an employees personal contact information may be restricted. We recommend that you consult with local counsel to determine whether collection of this information is permissible.

In some countries, an employees marital status can be collected only for certain purposes, such as when needed for payment of compensation. We recommend that you consult with local counsel to determine whether collection of this information is permissible.

In some countries, an employees marital status can be collected only for certain purposes, such as when needed for payment of compensation. We recommend that you consult with local counsel to determine whether collection of this information is permissible.

Select the person this employee reports to. Employees cannot report to themselves. A valid exception is for the one employee at the top of the reporting hierarchy, typically the company CEO. Only in this case, a value of 'one' is available and can be selected. Click the search (magnifying glass) icon to access the advanced search and filter your results.

Select a geographic differential. This adjusts the salary ranges for employees in designated locations, based on differences in the cost of living and cost of labor.
Select a geographic differential. This adjusts the salary ranges for employees in designated locations, based on differences in the cost of living and cost of labor.

Select a salary plan. This differentiates between groups of employees (for example, exempt vs. non-exempt employees, employees in different locations, and so on). It is the framework for placement of jobs within a formal compensation structure.

helperMessage.messageTxt: Select a salary plan. This differentiates between groups of employees (for example, exempt vs. non-exempt employees, employees in different locations, and so on). It is the framework for placement of jobs within a formal compensation structure.

/worker/workAssignment/payScaleCode/code.shortLabelName: Salary Plan/Grade/Step/Range/Compa Ratio, Next Step Date
/worker/workAssignment/payScaleCode/code.longLabelName: Salary Plan/Grade/Step/Range/Compa Ratio, Next Step Date

helperMessage.messageTxt: Displays if the employee is exempt, non-exempt, or has no FLSA status. The FLSA status code is determined from the FLSA Test Applied value (shown in parentheses) selected as part of the job code setup. The FLSA Test Applied value is the test used to determine if the job code should be classified as exempt or not exempt, if any, according to the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA).

Select a salary grade. This designates a rank and range of pay within a salary plan. The salary range within the grade contains a minimum, midpoint, and maximum amount. A salary plan may contain several salary grades.

/worker/workAssignment/payGradeCode.shortLabelName: Salary Plan/Grade/Step/Range/Compa Ratio, Next Step Date
/worker/workAssignment/payGradeCode.longLabelName: Salary Plan/Grade/Step/Range/Compa Ratio, Next Step Date

helperMessage.messageTxt: Select a salary step, if applicable, for the selected salary plan. A salary step is a specific rate of pay rather than a range of pay. Step progression is often used in educational and union environments.

helperMessage.messageTxt: Enter the date the employee is eligible to move to the next step rate. If you are using automated step progression, this date is already displayed.

helperMessage.messageTxt: Select how often the employee gets paid. Common pay frequencies include: Monthly, Semi-monthly (twice each month), Bi-weekly (every other week), Weekly, and Daily.
Select how often the employee gets paid. Common pay frequencies include: Monthly, Semi-monthly (twice each month), Bi-weekly (every other week), Weekly, and Daily.

Select the currency code. You can select a non-USD currency code if the employee is in a non-US pay group (both HR-only and paid pay groups). For US pay groups, the currency code defaults to USD. The employee's pay group is displayed on the Job Information Payroll tab.
Select a shift qualifier to identify a shift schedule. Shift qualifier codes are used to calculate shift differentials during payroll processing.
Select a shift qualifier to identify a shift schedule. Shift qualifier codes are used to calculate shift differentials during payroll processing.
If Cost Number Validation is turned on for this pay group, you must select a value from this list. Otherwise, you can enter and save a new cost number.
If Cost Number Validation is turned on for this pay group, you must select a value from this list. Otherwise, you can enter and save a new cost number.
Select a specific union.
Select a specific union.
Select the bargaining unit within the union.
Select the bargaining unit within the union.

Add pay rates in addition to the Primary Pay Rate for this job, as needed. You may want to add a different rate for overtime hours on a weekend, a different rate for holiday work hours, or a different rate for a certain shift. Rate 2 is already displayed in some cases, depending on pay group setup.
